datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 73
Origin: As appears in colophon on p.207, copied by Shaʻbān ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Muṣṭafá. Transcription completed ("tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah...") in 1082 [1671 or 1672].

Accompanying materials: Numerous inserts carrying glosses, etc. and one document, often tipped in (first not paginated between pp.86-87, then paginated pp.139-140, pp.151-152, pp.153-154. pp.203-204).
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 139. Commentary on al-Akaid al-adudiyah." ; "٣٧" on tail-edge of textblock.

Binding: Pasteboards faced in marbled paper with spine, fore-edge flap, and edges/turn-ins in red-brown leather (marbled paper faced, leather edged, framed binding) ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in laid paper ; sewn in black thread, two stations, sewing often broken resulting in many loose quires ; in poor condition with severe abrasion, lifting and losses of leather, delamination of boards, minor pest damage, minor spine slant (slightly cocked), etc. ; repairs in cloth and leather.

Support: European laid paper with 9 laid lines per cm. (vertical) and chain lines spaced 28 mm. apart ; watermarks include bird above hill or mount in scrollwork and paschal lamb (compare Heawood 2840) ; occasional staining.
Decoration: Keywords, section headings, and abbreviations rubricated ; some overlining and textual dividers in the form of circles in red.
Script: Naskh-nastaʻlīq (talik) ; sans serif ; effect of words descending to baseline ; mainly closed counters ; occasional elongated horizontal strokes and swooping descenders.
Layout: Written in 15 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: I (2), 5 V(52), I+1 (55), 4 V(95), I+1 (98), II (102), i ; chiefly quinions ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes inserts, skips two pages each between pp.55-56 and pp.157-158).

Colophon: "Scribal," rectangular, reads: "تمت هذه النسخة الشريفة الجليلة الكاملة في الاعتقاديات بعون الملك الوهاب على يد عبد الضعيف شعبان ابن الحاج ابراهيم ابن الحاج مصطفى تاريخه سنة اثنى وثمانين والف من الهجرة النبوية سنة ۱۰۸۲"
Explicit: "وهو على خلاف ما عرفه بعض المتأخرين جعل الاسباب موافقة ... وهب لنا من لدنك رحمة انك انت الوهاب واغفر لنا انك انت الكريم التواب"

Incipit: "يا من وفقنا لتحقيق العقائد الاسلامية وعصمنا عن التقليد في الاصول والفروع الكلامية ... وبعد فيقول العبد الفقير الى عفو ربه الغني محمد بن اسعد الصديقي الدواني ان العقائد العضدية لم تدع قاعدة في اصول العقائد الدينية الا دانت عليها ... فحداني ذلك الى اني اشرحها شرحا وافيا بحل المغالق ..."
Careful copy of the commentary on al-ʻAqāʼid by ʻAḍud al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Ījī (d. 756/1355).
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on interior of upper cover, "British Museum, London. No. 139. Commentary on al-Akaid al-adudiyah." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "131" in Western numerals on back flyleaf (p.210) ; circular waqf-seal impression in black ink appears on 'title page' (p.5) and several places throughout, reads: "هذا وقف الراجي فيض الصمدي الشيخ احمد ضيا الدين ابن مصطفى الخالدي فمن بدله بعد ما سمعه فانما اثمه على الذين يبدلونه" in name of Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khālidī (i.e. Ahmed Ziyâüddîn Gümüşhanevî, d. 1893 or 4) ; what appears to be a death notice on p.5 ; extensive marginal and interlinear glosses ; occasional marginal corrections.
Ījī, ʻAḍud al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad,
